The initial symptoms are high fever, myalgia, low back pain, nausea and vomiting. Moreover, the evolution to the severe form of disease presenting with jaundice, hemorrhages, and, in some cases, multiple organ failure and shock may occur. Opportunistic diseases may also appear, and, according to Maciel et al .
36 , disseminated mycosis (severe infection in yellow fever patients) can mimic bacterial sepsis.
